speaker:
FIRST
               
              LORD
text: Nay, good my lord, put him to ’t. Let him

speaker:
FIRST
               
              LORD
text: have his way.

speaker:
SECOND
               
              LORD
text: If your Lordship find him not a hilding,

speaker:
SECOND
               
              LORD
text: hold me no more in your respect.

speaker:
FIRST
               
              LORD
text: On my life, my lord, a bubble.

speaker: BERTRAM
text: Do you think I am so far deceived in him?

speaker:
FIRST
               
              LORD
text: Believe it, my lord. In mine own direct

speaker:
FIRST
               
              LORD
text: knowledge, without any malice, but to speak of

speaker:
FIRST
               
              LORD
text: him as my kinsman, he’s a most notable coward,

speaker:
FIRST
               
              LORD
text: an infinite and endless liar, an hourly promise-breaker,

speaker:
FIRST
               
              LORD
text: the owner of no one good quality worthy

speaker:
FIRST
               
              LORD
text: your Lordship’s entertainment.

speaker:
SECOND
               
              LORD
text: It were fit you knew him, lest, reposing

speaker:
SECOND
               
              LORD
text: too far in his virtue, which he hath not, he might

speaker:
SECOND
               
              LORD
text: at some great and trusty business in a main danger

speaker:
SECOND
               
              LORD
text: fail you.

speaker: BERTRAM
text: I would I knew in what particular action to

speaker: BERTRAM
text: try him.

speaker:
SECOND
               
              LORD
text: None better than to let him fetch off his

speaker:
SECOND
               
              LORD
text: drum, which you hear him so confidently undertake

speaker:
SECOND
               
              LORD
text: to do.

speaker:
FIRST
               
              LORD
text: I, with a troop of Florentines, will suddenly

speaker:
FIRST
               
              LORD
text: surprise him. Such I will have whom I am sure

speaker:
FIRST
               
              LORD
text: he knows not from the enemy. We will bind and

speaker:
FIRST
               
              LORD
text: hoodwink him so, that he shall suppose no other

speaker:
FIRST
               
              LORD
text: but that he is carried into the leaguer of the adversary’s

speaker:
FIRST
               
              LORD
text: when we bring him to our own tents. Be but

speaker:
FIRST
               
              LORD
text: your Lordship present at his examination. If he do

speaker:
FIRST
               
              LORD
text: not for the promise of his life, and in the highest

speaker:
FIRST
               
              LORD
text: compulsion of base fear, offer to betray you and

speaker:
FIRST
               
              LORD
text: deliver all the intelligence in his power against

speaker:
FIRST
               
              LORD
text: you, and that with the divine forfeit of his soul

speaker:
FIRST
               
              LORD
text: upon oath, never trust my judgment in anything.

speaker:
SECOND
               
              LORD
text: O, for the love of laughter, let him fetch

speaker:
SECOND
               
              LORD
text: his drum. He says he has a stratagem for ’t. When

speaker:
SECOND
               
              LORD
text: your Lordship sees the bottom of his success in

speaker:
SECOND
               
              LORD
text: ’t, and to what metal this counterfeit lump of ore

speaker:
SECOND
               
              LORD
text: will be melted, if you give him not John Drum’s

speaker:
SECOND
               
              LORD
text: entertainment, your inclining cannot be removed.

speaker:
SECOND
               
              LORD
text: Here he comes.

speaker:
FIRST
               
              LORD
text: O, for the love of laughter,

speaker:
FIRST
               
              LORD
text: hinder not the honor of his design. Let him

speaker:
FIRST
               
              LORD
text: fetch off his drum in any hand.

speaker: BERTRAM
text: How now, monsieur? This

speaker: BERTRAM
text: drum sticks sorely in your disposition.

speaker:
SECOND
               
              LORD
text: A pox on ’t! Let it go. ’Tis but a drum.

speaker: PAROLLES
text: But a drum! Is ’t but a drum? A drum so

speaker: PAROLLES
text: lost! There was excellent command, to charge in

speaker: PAROLLES
text: with our horse upon our own wings and to rend

speaker: PAROLLES
text: our own soldiers!

speaker:
SECOND
               
              LORD
text: That was not to be blamed in the command

speaker:
SECOND
               
              LORD
text: of the service. It was a disaster of war that

speaker:
SECOND
               
              LORD
text: Caesar himself could not have prevented if he had

speaker:
SECOND
               
              LORD
text: been there to command.

speaker: BERTRAM
text: Well, we cannot greatly condemn our success.

speaker: BERTRAM
text: Some dishonor we had in the loss of that

speaker: BERTRAM
text: drum, but it is not to be recovered.

speaker: PAROLLES
text: It might have been recovered.

speaker: BERTRAM
text: It might, but it is not now.

speaker: PAROLLES
text: It is to be recovered. But that the merit of

speaker: PAROLLES
text: service is seldom attributed to the true and exact

speaker: PAROLLES
text: performer, I would have that drum or another, or

speaker: PAROLLES
text: hic jacet.

speaker: BERTRAM
text: Why, if you have a stomach, to ’t, monsieur!

speaker: BERTRAM
text: If you think your mystery in stratagem can bring

speaker: BERTRAM
text: this instrument of honor again into his native

speaker: BERTRAM
text: quarter, be magnanimous in the enterprise and go

speaker: BERTRAM
text: on. I will grace the attempt for a worthy exploit. If

speaker: BERTRAM
text: you speed well in it, the Duke shall both speak of it

speaker: BERTRAM
text: and extend to you what further becomes his greatness,

speaker: BERTRAM
text: even to the utmost syllable of your

speaker: BERTRAM
text: worthiness.

speaker: PAROLLES
text: By the hand of a soldier, I will undertake it.

speaker: BERTRAM
text: But you must not now slumber in it.

speaker: PAROLLES
text: I’ll about it this evening, and I will presently

speaker: PAROLLES
text: pen down my dilemmas, encourage myself in my

speaker: PAROLLES
text: certainty, put myself into my mortal preparation;

speaker: PAROLLES
text: and by midnight look to hear further from me.

speaker: BERTRAM
text: May I be bold to acquaint his Grace you are

speaker: BERTRAM
text: gone about it?

speaker: PAROLLES
text: I know not what the success will be, my

speaker: PAROLLES
text: lord, but the attempt I vow.

speaker: BERTRAM
text: I know thou ’rt valiant, and to the possibility

speaker: BERTRAM
text: of thy soldiership will subscribe for thee. Farewell.

speaker: PAROLLES
text: I love not many words.

speaker:
FIRST
               
              LORD
text: No more than a fish loves water. Is not this

speaker:
FIRST
               
              LORD
text: a strange fellow, my lord, that so confidently seems

speaker:
FIRST
               
              LORD
text: to undertake this business which he knows is not

speaker:
FIRST
               
              LORD
text: to be done, damns himself to do, and dares better

speaker:
FIRST
               
              LORD
text: be damned than to do ’t?

speaker:
SECOND
               
              LORD
text: You do not know him, my lord, as we do.

speaker:
SECOND
               
              LORD
text: Certain it is that he will steal himself into a man’s

speaker:
SECOND
               
              LORD
text: favor and for a week escape a great deal of discoveries,

speaker:
SECOND
               
              LORD
text: but when you find him out, you have him

speaker:
SECOND
               
              LORD
text: ever after.

speaker: BERTRAM
text: Why, do you think he will make no deed at

speaker: BERTRAM
text: all of this that so seriously he does address himself

speaker: BERTRAM
text: unto?

speaker:
FIRST
               
              LORD
text: None in the world, but return with an

speaker:
FIRST
               
              LORD
text: invention and clap upon you two or three probable

speaker:
FIRST
               
              LORD
text: lies. But we have almost embossed him. You shall

speaker:
FIRST
               
              LORD
text: see his fall tonight; for indeed he is not for your

speaker:
FIRST
               
              LORD
text: Lordship’s respect.

speaker:
SECOND
               
              LORD
text: We’ll make you some sport with the fox

speaker:
SECOND
               
              LORD
text: ere we case him. He was first smoked by the old

speaker:
SECOND
               
              LORD
text: Lord Lafew. When his disguise and he is parted,

speaker:
SECOND
               
              LORD
text: tell me what a sprat you shall find him, which you

speaker:
SECOND
               
              LORD
text: shall see this very night.

speaker:
FIRST
               
              LORD
text: I must go look my twigs. He shall be

speaker:
FIRST
               
              LORD
text: caught.

speaker: BERTRAM
text: Your brother he shall go along with me.

speaker:
FIRST
               
              LORD
text: As ’t please your Lordship. I’ll leave you.

speaker: BERTRAM
text:
Now
               
              will
               
              I
               
              lead
               
              you
               
              to
               
              the
               
              house
               
              and
               
              show
               
              you

speaker: BERTRAM
text:
The
               
              lass
               
              I
               
              spoke
               
              of
              .

speaker:
SECOND
               
              LORD
text:
But
               
              you
               
              say
               
              she’s
               
              honest
              .

speaker: BERTRAM
text:
That’s
               
              all
               
              the
               
              fault
              .
               
              I
               
              spoke
               
              with
               
              her
               
              but
               
              once

speaker: BERTRAM
text:
And
               
              found
               
              her
               
              wondrous
               
              cold
              .
               
              But
               
              I
               
              sent
               
              to
               
              her
              ,

speaker: BERTRAM
text:
By
               
              this
               
              same
               
              coxcomb
               
              that
               
              we
               
              have
               
              i’
               
              th’
               
              wind
              ,

speaker: BERTRAM
text:
Tokens
               
              and
               
              letters
              ,
               
              which
               
              she
               
              did
               
              re-send
              .

speaker: BERTRAM
text:
And
               
              this
               
              is
               
              all
               
              I
               
              have
               
              done
              .
               
              She’s
               
              a
               
              fair
               
              creature
              .

speaker: BERTRAM
text:
Will
               
              you
               
              go
               
              see
               
              her
              ?

speaker:
SECOND
               
              LORD
text:
With
               
              all
               
              my
               
              heart
              ,
               
              my
               
              lord
              .
